intro: Gymnostachyum kwangsiense, commonly known as the Guangxi gymnostachyum, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
